content.title: Femoral Vessel Trauma
content.description: Management of femoral artery and vein injuries

key_concepts.details: Common femoral, superficial femoral, profunda femoris; vein posterior to artery
Longitudinal groin incision; proximal and distal control before entering hematoma
Primary repair, patch, interposition graft; profunda repair important for collateral flow
Repair if possible; ligation acceptable for SFV but expect swelling

content.clinical_significance: Good outcomes with prompt repair; 6-hour ischemia threshold critical
content.statement: Femoral Vessel Trauma is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Trauma that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Femoral Vessel Trauma helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Femoral Vessel Trauma include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Femoral Vessel Trauma.
